# applicationShouldOpenUntitledFile(_:)

**Instance Method**

Returns a Boolean value that indicates if the app can open an untitled file.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func applicationShouldOpenUntitledFile(_ sender: NSApplication) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **sender**: The application object associated with the delegate.

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the application should open a new untitled file or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] if it should not.

## Discussion

Use this method to decide whether the application should open a new, untitled file. Note that [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplicationDelegate/applicationOpenUntitledFile(_:)] is invoked if this method returns [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true].

## Opening Files

- **application(_:open:)**: Tells the delegate to open the resource at the specified URL.
- **application(_:openFile:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates if the app opens the specified file.
- **application(_:openFileWithoutUI:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates if the app opens the specified file without showing its user interface.
- **application(_:openTempFile:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates if the app opens the specified temporary file.
- **application(_:openFiles:)**: Tells the delegate to open the specified files.
- **applicationOpenUntitledFile(_:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates if the app opens an untitled file.
